# ðŸ“¦ Setup Instructions - Demo App
## Step 2: Push This Code to GitHub
## Step 1: Create GitHub Repository

1. Go to GitHub and create a new repository
2. Name it: `demo-app` (or any name you prefer)
3. Don't initialize with README (we'll push our own)

## Step 2: Push This Code to GitHub

**Note:** This app has NO Dockerfile - it will be auto-generated by the platform!

```bash
# Navigate to the sample app directory
cd /var/www/html/aiautomation/local-demo/sample-app

# Initialize git (if not already)
git init

# Add all files
git add .

# Commit
git commit -m "Initial commit - Demo app for AI deployment platform"

# Add remote (replace YOUR-USERNAME with your GitHub username)
git remote add origin https://github.com/YOUR-USERNAME/demo-app.git

# Push to GitHub
git branch -M main
git push -u origin main
```

## Step 3: Start Demo Server
## Step 3: Start Demo Server
In a separate terminal:

```bash
cd /var/www/html/aiautomation/local-demo
sudo ./start_demo_server.sh
```

## Step 4: Configure GitHub Webhook

1. Go to your repository on GitHub: `https://github.com/YOUR-USERNAME/demo-app`
2. Click **Settings** â†’ **Webhooks** â†’ **Add webhook**
3. Configure:
   - **Payload URL**: `http://YOUR-SERVER-IP:8001/webhooks/github`
     - Or use ngrok: `https://YOUR-NGROK-URL.ngrok-free.dev/webhooks/github`
   - **Content type**: `application/json`
   - **Which events**: Select "Just the push event"
   - **Active**: âœ“ (checked)
4. Click **Add webhook**

## Step 5: Test Deployment

Make a small change and push:

```bash
cd /var/www/html/aiautomation/local-demo/sample-app

# Make a change
echo "// Test deployment" >> index.js

# Commit and push
git add .
git commit -m "Test automatic deployment"
git push origin main
```

## Step 6: Watch the Magic! âœ¨

Watch the demo server terminal - you'll see:
- Repository cloned
- Code analyzed
- Docker image built
- Container deployed
- Nginx configured
- /etc/hosts updated
- URL shown!

## Step 7: Access Your App

Open in browser:
```
http://demo-app.local
```

Or if your repo has a different name:
```
http://YOUR-REPO-NAME.local
```

## âœ… Success!

Your app is now:
- âœ… Running in Docker container
- âœ… Accessible via Nginx
- âœ… Available in browser
- âœ… Automatically deployed on every push!

Make another change:

```bash
# Edit index.js and change the message
# Then:
git add .
git commit -m "Update app"
git push origin main
```

The deployment will automatically update! ðŸš€
